#summary Saving a copy of modifications to eeprom.

= Saving a copy of modifications to eeprom =

When PropForth starts up it is actually not using all of main memory. This is because the memory allocated to spin is not allocated to the forth dictionary. Assuming you have not modified PropForth.spin to leave spin running, we are now going to reclaim that memory. We are going to write a forth word which will change this, and then save a copy to eeprom so this happens automatically at each new reboot.

*reboot*
{{{
PropForth v2.0 2009APR19 11:00 0
Cog6 ok
}}}
*free*
{{{
417C bytes free - A3 cog longs free
Cog6 ok
}}}
* 0 wconstant build0*
{{{
Cog6 ok
}}}
*: boot6 cogid >cog lockdict 7FFF dup mswMemend w! mswDictend w! freedict ;*
{{{
Cog6 ok
}}}
*saveforth*
{{{
................................................................................................
Cog6 ok
}}}
*reboot*
{{{
PropForth v2.0 2009APR19 11:00 1
Cog6 ok
}}}
*free*
{{{
4319 bytes free - A3 cog longs free
Cog6 ok
}}}
